queries.description: the query will return all individuals who have been properly labeled as human

biocharacteristics.description: list of biocharacteristic_class objects with properly prefixed term ids, describing features of the individual which are not specific to the reported biosample(s); typical examples here are sex, species and "systemic" phenotypes and diseases

updated.description: The time of the last edit of this record, in ISO8601

id.description: The local-unique identifier of this individual (referenced as "individual_id").

data_use_conditions.description: Data use conditions applying to data from this individual, as ontology object (e.g. DUO).

geo_provenance.description:
This geo_class attribute ideally describes the geographic location of where this individual originates from.
This value may reflect either the place of burth or residence, but frequently may correspond to the place the study was performed.

info.description: additional variant information, as defined in the example and accompanying documentation

description.example: patient with lung cancer, male smoker
description.description: A free text description of the individual.

created.description: The creation time of this record, in ISO8601

info.description: An individual is a single organism (here typically a human).
